meanings.definition: In a sanctimonious manner; hypocritically pious or righteous.
meanings.sent1: She spoke sanctimoniously about helping others, but never actually did anything to assist.
meanings.sent2: He would often sanctimoniously lecture others on morality while ignoring his own faults.
meanings.sent3: The politician sanctimoniously promised to lower taxes, but everyone knew it was just empty words.
meanings.sent4: The CEO smiled sanctimoniously as he announced layoffs, showing his true colors.
meanings.sent5: Her sanctimoniously sweet smile hid a cunning and deceitful nature.
